center.h2: The Directory Structure of a Pustefix Project

lang.name: default
lang.h3: How to grow your own application at home
lang.p: First a short explanation what should be there before you start (we hope to make a script that generates a skeleton project from pfixcore but for now you have to do it yourself). The files and directories in the projects/ptutorial/ directory make up the xml/xsl part of the pustefix tutorial project (the java parts can be found in the src/ directory).

ul.li: conf/ servlet config, depends.xml -> build file for xsl stylesheets
txt/ files containing 'parts' used by multiple pages, navbars etc. -> empty now
txt/pages/ the actual pages: one sample page
xsl/ xsl metatags - for your basic app you do not need to edit this.

lang.name: default
lang.h3: Custom Files needed for the absolutely basic application

ul.li: conf/depends.xml.in -> each of your 'pages' is associated with a servlet and a layout in this file.
conf/[servletname].prop.in (for each servlet, usually two: one with ssl, one w/o ssl) -> basic servlet conf
xml/[yourlayout].xml -> you can have as many as you like, the tutorial contains only a very basic layout which should get you going (pfixcore sample app contains another example of a layout)

txt/page/[prefix]_[pagename].xml -> this is the example page of this application add some parts if you like more about parts in pages elsewhere :-), but each page needs a 'content' part. Take a look at some of the files in this directory of the tutorial to see what they look like.
